page.title: 16ST.DAVID.
page.content: St. David is the patron saint of Wales. He was born around 1400 years ago. His mother and father called him David because this means Beloved and they and everyone else loved him very much. He went to school in Dyfed. The school was a monastery where he learned to read and write about God. When he was older he became a priest. He travelled around and spread the word of God. He ended his travells in Wales where he built a monastery. Here he lived with other monks and led a very frugal life but he was very kind to others. He died in the year A.D. 589. A cathedral now stands on the site of his monastery. It is called St. David's Cathedral.
